channel.title: A little help
channel.description:
Sorry guys. I haven't been feeling good after a head injury. I can't remember much, so I need a little help.
I've recently added skillcapes to my server, and I can't remember how to make them need levels. For my server, 135 is the max, and I don't know how to make it so they need level 135 in the level to wear them. Any help would be great, but please, include code and where to add it.
Thanks!
[img]http://img404.imageshack.us/img404/4260/96611040mz3.png[/img]Vanack

item.title: A little help
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Vanack:

Vanack

What’s up with the Mod Vanack? I smell a wannabe :D.

[quote=“strengthxlx, post:4, topic:188764”]if (ItemName.startsWith(“attack cape”)) {
return 135;

That’d be under CLattack[/quote]
He’s right.

Read full topic

item.title: A little help
item.dc:creator: @glenash glenash
item.description:
@glenash wrote:

Lol Vanack stop lieing we all know you don’t know how to do it if you have proof and show pic of head injury then ill say sorry

Read full topic

item.title: A little help

item.description:
@strengthxlx wrote:

if (ItemName.startsWith(“attack cape”)) {
return 135;

That’d be under CLattack

item.title: A little help
item.dc:creator: @Vanack Vanack
item.description:
@Vanack wrote:

I know that, but I need a little more help than that. Like, what to put, and where it is, etc. Use 135 as the level in the code, for the ATT, DEF, HP, STR, PRAY, MAGE, and RANGE skillcapes. Would you please =]

Read full topic

item.title: A little help
item.dc:creator: @strengthxlx strengthxlx
item.description:
@strengthxlx wrote:

CLattack, CLstrength, CLdefence, etc.

Read full topic
